params.taskDescription:
Denying the hypothesis: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
  <mi>q</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">p \to q</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo>.</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\text{~}p.</annotation></semantics></math> Therefore, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo>.</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\text{~}q.</annotation></semantics></math>

params.taskDescription:
Affirming the consequent: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
  <mi>q</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">p \to q</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo>.</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">q.</annotation></semantics></math> Therefore, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo>.</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">p.</annotation></semantics></math>

params.ariaNavigatedToSolution: Navigated to newly included sample solution after textarea.

params.taskDescription:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo>∧<!-- ∧ --></mo>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
  <mi>r</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">p \wedge q \to r</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>r</mi>
  <mo>.</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\text{~}r.</annotation></semantics></math> Therefore, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo>∨<!-- ∨ --></mo>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo>.</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\text{~}p \vee \text{~}q.</annotation></semantics></math>

questionSetStimulus: For the following exercises, use a truth table or construct a Venn diagram to prove whether the following arguments are valid.
